Class Factory

java.lang.Object
esinf.model.Factory
public class Factory extends Object
The Factory class is responsible for managing a list of articles and a list of machines. It provides functionalities to initialize the factory with these lists, retrieve and update them, as well as to calculate and sort production related data.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Factory

      public Factory()
      Constructs a new Factory instance with empty lists for articles and machines. This no-argument constructor initializes the factory to have an empty ArrayList for both articles and machines.

    • Factory

      public Factory(List<Article> articles, List<Machine> machines)
      Constructs a new Factory instance with specified lists of articles and machines.
      Parameters:
      articles - the list of articles to be managed by the factory
      machines - the list of machines to be used by the factory

    • calculateTotalProductionInMinutes

      public List<Pair<String,Integer>> calculateTotalProductionInMinutes(List<Article> articles)
      Calculates the total production time in minutes for each item in the provided list. Each item's total production time is accumulated based on the operations it requires and the machines available that can perform those operations.
      Parameters:
      articles - a list of articles for which the total production time needs to be calculated
      Returns:
      a list of pairs, where each pair contains the item ID as a string and the total production time in minutes as an integer. If the provided articles list is empty or does not match the factory's articles list, an empty list is returned. Time Complexity : O(n^2) (bubbleSortListByID complexity predominance) Space Complexity : O(1)

    • operationTimeReport

      public List<Pair<String,Pair<Integer,Double>>> operationTimeReport(List<Machine> machines)
      Generates a report on the operation times for a list of machines. Each machine's execution time and its percentage contribution to the total execution time are included in the report.
      Parameters:
      machines - the list of Machine objects for which the report is generated
      Returns:
      a list of pairs, where each pair contains a machine ID as a string and another pair. The nested pair consists of the execution time of the machine (integer) and its percentage contribution to the total execution time (double). If the provided machines list is empty or does not match the factory's machines list, an empty list is returned. Time Complexity: O(n^2) (due to bubble sort) Space Complexity: O(1)

    • recordMachineProcessingFlow

      public Map<String,Map<String,Integer>> recordMachineProcessingFlow()
      Records the flow of machine processing by tracking how articles move between machines.
      Returns:
      a sorted map where the key is the machine ID and the value is another map, which contains the next machine and the count of transitions. Time Complexity: O(m * n), where m is the number of articles and n is the average number of operations per item Space Complexity: O(m * n)

    • totalExecutionTime

      public int totalExecutionTime()
      Calculates the total execution time for all the machines in this factory.
      Returns:
      the total execution time in minutes for all the machines in the factory.

    • calculateTotalOperationTimeInMinutes

      public List<Pair<String,Integer>> calculateTotalOperationTimeInMinutes()
      US4 - Calculates the total execution time for each operation in the factory. This method iterates over all available machines, checks the operations they perform, and sums the total time spent on each operation. The result is a list of pairs where the first element is the operation name and the second is the total time in minutes.
      Returns:
      a list of pairs (operation name, total time in minutes) for each operation performed in the factory. Returns an empty list if no machines are available. Time Complexity: O(m * n), where m is the number of machines and n is the number of articles Space Complexity: O(m * n)

    • runSimulation

      public void runSimulation()
      Runs the simulation process. It manages the execution of operations based on the available machines, item priorities, and operation queues. The simulation processes articles operation by operation, assigning available machines to articles, and advancing the clock based on operation completion times. Time Complexity: O(p + o log o), where p is the number of operations and o is the total number of operations performed. Space Complexity: O(m + k + o), where m is the number of articles, k is the number of machines, and o is the number of operations.

    • calculateTotalTimeForItems

      public void calculateTotalTimeForItems(Map<Article,Integer> itemEndTimes)
      Calculates the total time each item took to complete all its operations. The total time is determined by subtracting 1 (start time) from the end time of the last operation.
      Parameters:
      itemEndTimes - a map where the key is the item and the value is the end time of its last operation. Time Complexity: O(m), where m is the number of articles. Space Complexity: O(m), as it requires storage for the itemEndTimes map.

    • trackItemMachineSequence

      public Map<String,List<String>> trackItemMachineSequence()
      Tracks the sequence of machines that process each item based on the operations required by the item. For each item, it creates a list of machine IDs that can perform the operations listed in the item.
      Returns:
      a map where the key is the item ID and the value is a list of machine IDs that can process the item. Each machine is responsible for executing one or more operations required by the item. Time Complexity: O(m * n), where m is the number of articles and n is the number of machines. Space Complexity: O(m * k), where k is the average number of operations per item.

    • getSortedMachineProcessingFlow

      public Map<String,Map<String,Integer>> getSortedMachineProcessingFlow(Map<String,Map<String,Integer>> unsorted)
      Sorts a map of machine processing flow based on the total number of transitions.
      Parameters:
      unsorted - the unsorted map where the key is the machine ID and the value is another map of transitions
      Returns:
      a sorted map where the machines with the most transitions appear first Time Complexity: O(n^2), where n is the number of machines Space Complexity: O(1)

    • displayMachineWithMostFlowDependency

      public List<Pair<String,Integer>> displayMachineWithMostFlowDependency(Map<String,Map<String,Integer>> machineFlowMap)
      Displays the machine with the highest flow dependency, i.e., the machine that has the most transitions from other machines.
      Parameters:
      machineFlowMap - a map where the key is the machine ID and the value is another map of transitions
      Returns:
      a list containing a single pair, where the key is the machine ID and the value is the number of transitions Time Complexity: O(n), where n is the number of machines Space Complexity: O(1)
